perturbation.original_text: Section 4. Fees and Expenses. (a) If there has been a successful Remarketing, the Company shall pay to the Remarketing Agent for the  performance of its services as Remarketing Agent hereunder on the Remarketing Settlement Date, by wire transfer to an account designated by the  Remarketing Agent, a fee in an amount equal to 25 basis points (0.25%) of the Accreted Value of the Remarketed Securities.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4. Fees and Expenses. (a) If there has been a successful Remarketing, the Company shall pay to the Remarketing Agent for the  performance of its services as Remarketing Agent hereunder within 10 business days of the Remarketing Settlement Date, by wire transfer to an account designated by the  Remarketing Agent, a fee in an amount equal to 25 basis points (0.25%) of the Accreted Value of the Remarketed Securities.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by altering the payment deadline. Initially, the fee was due *on* the Remarketing Settlement Date. Now, it's due *within 10 business days* of that date. This creates uncertainty because both clauses define the payment deadline, leading to ambiguity about the actual due date.

perturbation.original_text: Section 11. Termination. This Agreement shall terminate (i) the Business Day immediately following the Remarketing Settlement Date, (ii) at 5:00  p.m., New York City time, on the last date of the Remarketing if the Remarketing is not successful or (iii) on the effective date of the resignation or  removal of the Remarketing Agent and the appointment of a new Remarketing Agent.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 11. Termination. This Agreement shall terminate (i) 30 days after the Business Day immediately following the Remarketing Settlement Date, (ii) at 5:00  p.m., New York City time, on the last date of the Remarketing if the Remarketing is not successful or (iii) on the effective date of the resignation or  removal of the Remarketing Agent and the appointment of a new Remarketing Agent.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by altering the termination date. Initially, the agreement terminates the business day immediately following the settlement date. Now, it terminates 30 days after that business day. This creates ambiguity about when obligations cease and when the parties can no longer rely on the agreement being in effect.

perturbation.original_text: Section 14. Survival. The respective indemnities, representations, warranties and agreements of the Issuers and the Remarketing Agent contained  in this Agreement or made by or on behalf of them, respectively, pursuant to this Agreement, shall survive the Remarketing and shall remain in full  force and effect, regardless of any termination or cancellation of this Agreement or any investigation made by or on behalf of any of them or any  person controlling any of them.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 14. Survival. The respective indemnities, representations, warranties and agreements of the Issuers and the Remarketing Agent contained  in this Agreement or made by or on behalf of them, respectively, pursuant to this Agreement, shall survive the Remarketing for 1 year, and shall remain in full  force and effect, regardless of any termination or cancellation of this Agreement or any investigation made by or on behalf of any of them or any  person controlling any of them.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by limiting the survival period. Initially, the agreement states that the indemnities, representations, warranties survive the remarketing indefinitely, which means it remains in full force. Now, it is limited to 1 year. This introduces ambiguity about how long obligations from the original agreement remain in effect.
